column1: The figures in this boat were those of a strong man with ragged grizzled hair and a sun-browned face
column2: and a dark girl of nineteen or twenty
column3: sufficiently like him to be recognizable as his daughter. The girl rowed
column4: pulling a pair of sculls very easily; the man
column5: with the rudder-lines slack in his hands
column6: and his hands loose in his waistband
column7: kept an eager look out. He had no net
column10: and he could not be a fisherman; his boat had no cushion for a sitter
column13: no appliance beyond a rusty boathook and a coil of rope
column14: and he could not be a waterman; his boat was too crazy and too small to take in cargo for delivery
column15: and he could not be a lighterman or river-carrier; there was no clue to what he looked for
column17: with a most intent and searching gaze.
